results.title: Otherwise known as Sheila the great
results.brief_description: Ten year old Sheila Tubman faces some of her worst fears, including swimming, dogs and the dark, when her family spends the summer in the countryside of Tarrytown. In Tarrytown, Sheila meets Mouse Ellis, Junior Yo Yo Champion, dog lover and terrific swimmer. Sheila pretends to Mouse that she is not afraid of anything…but Mouse is not fooled. Based on the story by best-selling children’s writer, Judy Blume.

results.title: Others
results.creator_credit: Wombat Productions, Inc. and Gene Feldman
results.brief_description: A young boy treated unfairly by his teacher, seeks refuge in solitude and other relationships. Ultimately he is faced with accepting the teacher’s tentative approaches or withdrawing into himself.

results.title: Other people's property
results.brief_description: Focuses attention on the problem of vandalism and the need for respect for other people’s property. The film tells the story of three boys who caused damage to a schoolroom because they failed to think about the possible consequences of their actions. The roles of each of the three boys involved in the incident are discussed and the point made that the prank would not have happened if each boy had acted on his own conscience.

results.title: Other olympics
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Kevin Boulton and Don Worley
results.brief_description: A look at the 1980 Olympics for the disabled held in Arnhem, Netherlands because Moscow declined the offer to stage the event, in which thousands of handicapped people competed in a wide range of events. The first Disabled games was held in London 1948, only 16 competetors, 1960 in Rome - 400 competetors, but, in 1980 over 42 countries competed. The partcipants included paraplegics, quadraplegics, amputees, people who have cerebal palsey, polio and varying degrees of blindness. It was at these games that users and wheelchair designers explored and exhibited new designs to assist the handicapped. H.R.H.Princess Margaritte opened the games which had the ideals of friendship, unity and sportsmanship. Many world records were broken. This program was narrated by Richard Morecroft.

results.title: Othello [Dubbed]
results.brief_description: Sergei Yutkevich liberates the play from the confines of the stage and uses realistic backgrounds to recreate Shakespeares “Port in Cyprus”. The text has been closely edited to concentrate attention on the relationship between Othello and Iago, and attention to visual details helps to underline the salient points of the original plot. Awarded the prize for direction at the 1956 Cannes Film Festival. Original music by Aram Khachaturyan. (Film is dubbed in English). Title and credits missing.

results.title: Othello
results.brief_description: This magnificent film was shot on location throughout Europe and North Africa with a multinational cast and crew. Producer/director Orson Welles plays Othello and considered it to be one of his best films. Sadly, the film was believed to be lost for over thirty years. Finally, the original nitrate negative was tracked down and using today’s most innovative techniques, the film has been restored frame by frame to its original 91 minute director’s cut. Now this film is finally accessible to whole new generations of movie audiences.

results.title: Othello
results.creator_credit: Stuart Burge, Anthony Havelock-Allan and John Brabourne
results.brief_description: National Theatre of Great Britain’s stage production of William Shakespeare’s play. Features Laurence Olivier, Maggie Smith, Derek Jacobi and Frank Finlay. Although the lighting is very dark at times making the action hard to discern, this dramatisation is very powerful and moving.

results.title: Othello
results.creator_credit: Dakota Films, Imminent Films, Luc Roeg, David Barron and Oliver Parker
results.brief_description: Othello: an intoxicating mix of love, sexual passion and the deadly power of jealousy. Riddled with jealousy and twisted with racial hatred, Iago (Kenneth Branagh) schemes and plots his way to torturing the love of Othello (Laurence Fishburne) and Desdemona (Irene Jacob). In a visually stunning and superbly acted masterpiece, Othello tells the most passionate tale of love and betrayal of all time.

results.title: Otello
results.creator_credit: Golan-Globus Productions, Cannon Productions, Menahem Golan, Yoram Globus and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: Otello, the opera by Giuseppe Verdi, libretto by Arigo Boito, based on Shakespeare’s play and adapted for the screen by Franco Zeffirelli and Masolino D’Amico. Magnificent camera work by Ennio Guarnieri, in majestic natural surroundings with splendidly rendered music distinguishes this retelling of Venice’s Moor governor of Cyprus. Otello (Placido Domingo) has the poison of jealousy infused in his veins by his friend, Iago (Justino Diaz). The latter, by means of manipulating with a handkerchief once given as a love token gift, has Otello kill his beloved wife Desdomena (Katia Ricciarelli), then Iago and finally himself. All this whilst young Cassio (Desdomena’s supposed but innocent lover) watches what havoc men wreak on their souls and bodies when passion has relieved them of reason. Performers include Petra Malakova, Urbano Barberini, Sergio Nicolai, Edwin Francis, Massimo Foschi and features the Orchestra and Chorus of Teatro Scala of Milan, music produced and conducted by Lorin Maazel. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.
